species.name: Bluefin Tuna
species.description: The Atlantic bluefin tuna is one of the largest, fastest, and most gorgeously colored of all the world's fishes. Their torpedo-shaped, streamlined bodies are built for speed and endurance. Their coloring—metallic blue on top and shimmering silver-white on the bottom—helps camouflage them from above and below.

species.name: Atlantic Cod
species.description: Atlantic cod is a benthopelagic fish found in the colder waters of the North Atlantic. It has been an important food source for centuries and is known for its white, flaky flesh. Overfishing has significantly reduced populations in some areas.

species.name: Pacific Salmon
species.description: Pacific salmon are anadromous fish, meaning they are born in freshwater, migrate to the ocean, and return to freshwater to spawn. They play a crucial role in marine and freshwater ecosystems.
species.habitat: Freshwater rivers and streams, open ocean

species.name: European Eel
species.description: The European eel is a critically endangered species that has experienced dramatic population declines. They have a complex life cycle, spawning in the Sargasso Sea and migrating to European rivers.

species.name: Yellowfin Tuna
species.description: Yellowfin tuna are found in tropical and subtropical waters worldwide. They are highly valued for their meat and are a popular target for commercial and sport fishing.

species.name: Atlantic Halibut
species.description: The Atlantic halibut is the largest flatfish in the world. It is a bottom-dwelling fish found in the cold waters of the North Atlantic. Overfishing has severely impacted populations.

species.name: Mackerel
species.description: Atlantic mackerel is a fast-swimming, schooling fish found in the North Atlantic. It is an important commercial species and a key part of the marine food web.

species.name: Swordfish
species.description: Swordfish are large, highly migratory, predatory fish characterized by a long, flat, pointed bill. They are found in temperate and tropical waters worldwide.

species.name: Atlantic Herring
species.description: Atlantic herring is one of the most abundant fish species in the world. They form large schools and are a crucial part of the marine ecosystem, serving as prey for many larger fish, marine mammals, and seabirds.

species.name: Giant Grouper
species.description: The giant grouper is the largest bony fish found in coral reefs. They are slow-growing, long-lived fish that are vulnerable to overfishing. They play an important role in maintaining reef ecosystem balance.

species.name: Orange Roughy
species.description: Orange roughy is a deep-sea fish that can live for over 100 years. They are slow-growing and late-maturing, making them extremely vulnerable to overfishing. Deep-sea trawling has severely impacted populations.

species.name: Skipjack Tuna
species.description: Skipjack tuna is the most abundant and widely distributed tuna species. They are fast-growing and highly productive, making them more resilient to fishing pressure than other tuna species.

species.name: Atlantic Blue Marlin
species.description: The Atlantic blue marlin is one of the largest and most recognizable billfish. They are highly migratory and are prized by sport fishermen. Commercial fishing and bycatch have impacted populations.

species.name: Red Snapper
species.description: Red snapper is a popular commercial and recreational fish found in the Gulf of Mexico and western Atlantic. They are long-lived and slow-growing, making them vulnerable to overfishing.

species.name: Chilean Sea Bass
species.description: Chilean sea bass, also known as Patagonian toothfish, is a deep-sea fish found in cold southern waters. They are slow-growing and long-lived, making them vulnerable to overfishing. Illegal fishing has been a major concern.

species.name: Mahi-Mahi
species.description: Mahi-mahi, also known as dolphinfish, is a surface-dwelling ray-finned fish found in off-shore temperate, tropical, and subtropical waters worldwide. They are known for their vibrant colors and are popular in sport fishing.

species.name: Barramundi
species.description: Barramundi is a catadromous fish found in the Indo-Pacific region. They are highly valued for their taste and are an important species in aquaculture. They can live in both freshwater and saltwater.

species.name: Atlantic Pollock
species.description: Atlantic pollock is a commercially important fish found in the North Atlantic. They are closely related to cod and are known for their white, flaky flesh. They form schools and are found in both coastal and deeper waters.

species.name: Haddock
species.description: Haddock is a saltwater fish found in the North Atlantic. They are closely related to cod and are an important commercial species. Overfishing has led to population declines in some areas.

species.name: King Mackerel
species.description: King mackerel is a migratory species found in the western Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico. They are popular among sport fishermen and are known for their speed and fighting ability.

species.name: Wahoo
species.description: Wahoo is a fast-swimming predatory fish found in tropical and subtropical seas worldwide. They are highly prized by sport fishermen for their speed and are also commercially important.

species.name: Grouper (Various Species)
species.description: Groupers are large, heavy-bodied fish found in warm seas. Many species are slow-growing and long-lived, making them vulnerable to overfishing. They are important predators on coral reefs.

species.name: Tilefish
species.description: Tilefish are deep-water fish found on the continental shelf and slope. They are known for their colorful appearance and are valued commercially. Deep-sea fishing has impacted some populations.

species.name: Monkfish
species.description: Monkfish, also known as anglerfish, are bottom-dwelling fish found in the North Atlantic. They are known for their large mouth and are commercially important. Overfishing has reduced populations.

species.name: Black Sea Bass
species.description: Black sea bass is a bottom-dwelling fish found along the Atlantic coast of North America. They are popular among recreational and commercial fishermen. Management measures have helped stabilize populations.

species.name: Striped Bass
species.description: Striped bass is an anadromous fish found along the Atlantic coast of North America. They are highly valued by sport fishermen and are an important commercial species. Conservation efforts have been successful.

species.name: Flounder
species.description: Flounder are flatfish found in coastal waters. They are bottom-dwellers with both eyes on one side of their body. They are commercially important but face pressure from fishing and habitat loss.

species.name: Turbot
species.description: Turbot is a large flatfish found in the North Atlantic, Baltic Sea, and Mediterranean. They are highly valued for their delicate flavor and are an important commercial species. Overfishing has impacted populations.

species.name: Sole
species.description: Common sole is a flatfish found in the eastern Atlantic and Mediterranean. They are bottom-dwellers and are highly valued commercially. Overfishing and habitat degradation have reduced populations.

species.name: Plaice
species.description: European plaice is a common flatfish found in the North Atlantic and Baltic Sea. They are commercially important and are found in shallow coastal waters. Overfishing has impacted populations.

species.name: Anchovy
species.description: European anchovy is a small, schooling fish found in the Mediterranean and eastern Atlantic. They are an important commercial species and play a crucial role in the marine food web as prey for larger fish.

species.name: Sardine
species.description: European sardine is a small, schooling fish found in the Mediterranean and eastern Atlantic. They are commercially important and are often canned. They form large schools and are prey for many marine predators.

species.name: Tuna (Albacore)
species.description: Albacore tuna is a medium-sized tuna found in temperate and tropical waters worldwide. They are known for their white meat and are important commercially. They are fast swimmers and highly migratory.

species.name: Bigeye Tuna
species.description: Bigeye tuna is a large tuna species found in tropical and subtropical waters worldwide. They are commercially important and are known for their large eyes. Overfishing has led to population declines.

species.name: Sea Bream
species.description: Gilt-head sea bream is a popular fish in Mediterranean cuisine. They are found in coastal waters and are important both commercially and in aquaculture. They are known for their distinctive golden stripe.

species.name: European Seabass
species.description: European seabass is a popular fish in Mediterranean cuisine. They are found in coastal waters and estuaries, and are highly valued for their delicate flavor and firm white flesh.

species.name: Red Mullet
species.description: Red mullet is a highly prized fish in Mediterranean cuisine, known for its distinctive red color and delicate flavor. They are bottom-dwelling fish found in sandy and rocky areas.
species.habitat: Coastal waters, sandy and rocky bottoms

species.name: Mediterranean Grouper
species.description: The Mediterranean grouper is a large fish found in rocky coastal areas. They are slow-growing and long-lived, making them vulnerable to overfishing. They are highly valued in Mediterranean cuisine.

species.name: Mediterranean Sardine
species.description: Mediterranean sardines are small, schooling fish found throughout the Mediterranean and eastern Atlantic. They are an important commercial species and are rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

species.name: Dentex
species.description: Dentex is a large predatory fish found in the Mediterranean. They are known for their strong teeth and are highly valued in Mediterranean cuisine for their firm, flavorful flesh.
species.habitat: Rocky and sandy bottoms, coastal waters

species.name: Pandora
species.description: Pandora, also known as common pandora, is a popular fish in Mediterranean cuisine. They are found in coastal waters and are known for their pinkish color and delicate flavor.
species.habitat: Coastal waters, sandy and muddy bottoms

species.name: Striped Red Mullet
species.description: Striped red mullet is a close relative of the red mullet, found throughout the Mediterranean. They are highly prized for their delicate flavor and are often grilled or fried whole.

species.name: Bogue
species.description: Bogue is a common fish in the Mediterranean, found in schools near the coast. They are an important commercial species and are often used in Mediterranean fish stews and soups.

species.name: Picarel
species.description: Picarel is a small fish found throughout the Mediterranean. They form large schools and are commonly used in Mediterranean cuisine, often fried or grilled whole.
species.habitat: Coastal waters, rocky and sandy areas

species.name: Common Sole
species.description: Common sole is a flatfish found in the eastern Atlantic and Mediterranean. They are bottom-dwellers and are highly valued commercially. Overfishing and habitat degradation have reduced populations.
